greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A289272(floor(A289271(n)/2)).
comment: For all n > 1, in the binary tree illustrated in A289272, the node which contains (has value) n, its parent node has value a(n).
Each n occurs exactly twice in this sequence.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
program: A289271(n) = { my(v=0,i=0,x=1); for(d=2,oo,if(n==1, return(v)); if(1==gcd(x,d)&&1==omega(d), if(!(n%d)&&1==gcd(d,n/d), v += 2^i; n /= d; x *= d); i++)); }; \\ After _Rémy Sigrist_'s program for A289271.
A289272(n) = { my(m=1, pp=1); while(n>0, pp++; while(!isprimepower(pp)||(gcd(pp,m)>1), pp++); if(n%2, m *= pp); n >>=1); (m); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 01 2019
